description: Number of ways to factor n into members of A050376.
comments: a(n) depends only on prime signature of n (cf. A025487). So a(24) = a(375) since 24=2^3*3 and 375=3*5^3 both have prime signature (3,1).Multiplicative with a(p^e) = A018819(e). - _Christian G. Bower_ and _David W. Wilson_, May 22 2005
links: R. Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Dirichlet g.f.: Product_{n in A050376} (1/(1-1/n^s)).a(n) = Sum{a(d): d^2 divides n}, a(1) = 1. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 12 2007
maple: A018819:= proc(n) option remember;  if n::odd then procname(n-1)  else procname(n-1) + procname(n/2)  fiend proc:A018819(0):= 1:f:= n -> mul(A018819(s[2]),s=ifactors(n)[2]):seq(f(n),n=1..100); # _Robert Israel_, Jan 14 2016
author: _Christian G. Bower_, Nov 15 1999
